We meet at last, impostor! Tell me who you are to challenge Karim of the Silver Hand, the Ghost of Justice!
Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Sherlock Holmes and I will be the one to bring you, the murderer, to justice.
I am the true Karim and I'm here to bring you, the dishonorable murderer, to justice!
Justice? What do you know about justice, humbug? That hack Uzay deserved to die!
And who are you to decide who lives and who dies?
I am the only person in this city who really cares about the common folk! Uzay was torturing the whole market for years and the police did nothing!
I tried to to scare him off. God be my witness, I did everything to avoid bloodshed. But he just refused to listen!
Nice plan you had there. Kill Uzay and then dress him in your own clothes to kill two birds with one stone.
You're a witty one, aren't you? Yes. Karim is a legend. And all legends have to die.
Uzay was meant to be my one and only victim.
Off with the masks. If you are who you think you are - you'll reveal yourself this instant!
Not so fast. Know that if I take my mask off only one of us will get out of here.

If you wish. My name is Giacomo Piccolo and I'm a performer at the local theatre.

On three... two... one!
What's your name, young lady?
Did you come to save me from the witch?
No. You're too old for a prince.
I certainly don't hold any such title. Why?
What does it matter, if you're not a prince?

The wicked witch who wears many faces, and eats little children. She guards herself with spikes.
This old head crowns young shoulders.
Ohhh... Okay.
What are those punctures on your arms?
It's where I was pricked with a needle. I was trying not to - I didn't want to go to sleep. it's never a prince that wakes me up!
Watson! Something terrible is in preparation, come at once and ask your army friends to come along!
Holmes! What is it now? One of those cases?
Yes, Watson. One of those cases you used to love to write about.
I'm afraid my taste changed lately. After the case of the escaped Gorilla, my literary talents dried.
The two days you spent in this cage were very important to this affair, as to what happened between you and this female ape, that's the call of nature.
Your talents were in the right place, while mine were put at good use catching this thief.
I feel my dignity remain lost forever there. Why would I help you? And why would I ask for the concourse of truly faithful friends?
Someone estranged a crippled soldier in order to steal a precious Emerald.
Interesting, how the thief will operate?
The thief will go through the rooves, from the veteran board house to the Jewelry exhibit room.
Show me the way, I'll grab my pistol.
I can't say I'm convinced, Holmes. I don't think my friends will take this seriously.
Good day, Marco.
I'm sorry, signor, I don't think we've met before. How do you know my name?
Oh, it's elementary. The cart with bread is obviously yours, judging by the way you look at the damages caused to it.
It was brought here yesterday evening. The bread is not stale yet, but it's already cold. And there is only one man that sells yesterday's bread in the vicinity.
Assuming, of course, my housekeeper signora Alsatti is to be believed. She complained about it quite a few times.
I... oh, you must be signor Holmes. She told me about you!
Pleased to meet you too.
And now, please, tell me everything in detail.
Well, yesterday evening I made a new batch of bread and left it here, near my house. As usual, I went to the pub to have a drink or two.
When I returned near sundawn, a man rushed out of the courtyard. Wild eyes, knife flashing! He scared me almost to death!
Didn't see his face, it was too dark. But then I noticed all the blood and ruckus here. And the body! I immediately called the police.
Do you know who the victim is?
Oh yes, it's my neighbor Uzay Behcet. A shady kind, hot-tempered, mean guy. I've always suspected there's something wrong with him.
But who could've thought that he was behind the mask of Karim!
What do you mean "shady kind"?
Well, you know, dealing in some stuff the police wouldn't approve. I don't know much, except that he spent most of his time in Scaladio.
I never asked him, you see. Safer that way.
Thank you, Marco. That's it for now.
Greetings, mister. I need a specific outfit. Here's the picture.
Will do, sir.
I'm in dire need of a set of clothes fit for a ratcatcher. Can you help me with it?
Oh, signore Holmes! I did not know it was you! Anything for my favorite customer!
Keep the change!
Good day, mam. I'm here to help you to describe the murderer.
Oh, a new one! I hope you'll be more patient, signor!
My name is Sherlock Holmes. Can you describe the villain, please?
Oh my... I looked him right in the eyes! He was all nasty and stonkered, like all of those killers are! He was a total bandit, and even the glasses could not hide it!
Well, well, I think I got the point. I'll try to disguise myself and show it to you.
You can find lots of clothes in my storage. I sewed them for the local theatres for forty years!
No, no, no, signor. He was nothing like that, he was dressed up in a new suit... all like... fancy! The really great fabric - the best one we can afford on Gollanza...
Well, let's try another one.
He wore glasses, yes, but nothing like these! These give one's face a soft nice emotion. And he had sharp edgier, evil glasses!
I'll try another one...
And also he had a hat. Didn't I tell about the hat? It didn't go well with his suit - what an awful taste that man had!
What was it then?
Oh... just a regular hat. Black and kinda aristocratic.
That is one of the wrong hats, signor. I told you - a regular one! Not police officers, not a fancy one, just a usual hat! How was it called? The bowler... right?
You could have told it from the very beginning!
But I DID! You have to pay attention to details, signor!
There's something wrong with your face, mister.
My face is fine.
It lacks something... like a moustache!
So the murderer wore a moustache?
He sure did! Thin, pointy, nasty moustache! You could tell he's a rascal right away by only looking at them!
I'll try to find something like that...
I'm sorry to tell this to you, signor, but your face needs to be beaten...
I hope that won't happen to me. You mean the criminal had bruises?
He sure missed a few strong punches! Right in the face! Got what he deserves!
Perhaps I can do this to myself with some make-up...
My, oh my! You look just like him... but something is still missing...
What. Is. NOT. RIGHT!?
I'm scared... You are acting just like that sketch artist from the earlier! The fabric of your suit is not quite right... this one is plain and simple white, but his one was rich and golden!
Like the ring, I inherited from my respected and beloved mo...
Please stop... I got it.
Oh no, no, no! You look nothing like him. Not a single piece matches...
Ehm, maybe you can just tell what's wrong?
Everything. I told you he was beaten badly and looked so evil in his glasses! He had a hat and seemed to be a sneaky gigolo from Grand-Saray!
Good day, officer. How did you get here unnoticed? I thought you ran away, leaving all your sketches behind! You won't yell at me anymore, will you, signor?
Excuse me, I can't promise that.
Oh no... When my husband was alive he did that all the time and I never could understand why... And now you do the same! What's wrong with you, men?
Aaaah! Ahh! It's you again! Oh no! Police, help, he's here!
It's me, Holmes. I guess now I look like him?
Oh my God, signor! You scared me to death! Haven't they told you not to prank old women? You have no heart, signor Holmes!
I have my brains, and that's enough. Good evening, stay safe, signora!
Good day to you, Mr. Holmes.
Good Day, Miss.
What brought you here, miss?
I'm Sanders. Dorothy Sanders. I heard that you are good at finding lost people. I want you to find my daughter, Rebecca.
Indeed, I am. Why children leave their home unannounced is usually a question to their parents, however.
Mr. Holmes, I'm a grieving mother and I'm in need for help.
Pray tell, Miss Sanders.
Rebecca died of phthisis two weeks ago. Yesterday I saw an announcement in the newspaper about her wedding.
Love beyond the grave? who was her fiance?
There was none, Mr. Holmes. Never. My daughter needs to rest in peace. I don't want anything else.
I presume you did search for her yourself?
I went to the cemetery at once. her grave was empty.
What do expect me to do?
Find Rebecca and return her to me. I can't sleep thinking that her grave is desecrated and she's not at her rightful place.
Rest for the dead is rest for the living. Anything else you can tell me?
Yes. Here's the newspaper and our photo. I hope that'll help.
What would be my compensation?
I don't have much, but I think this will be enough. I'll give you her pearl necklace.
Are you sure about it?
Yes. She doesn't need it now, and me neither. I hope you are an honest man, Mr. Holmes.
I believe others think I am, Miss Sanders.
I'm sorry, I couldn't return your daughter's body.
I expected more from you, Mr. Holmes. What happened?
Her real mother, Martha Preston, claimed the body. It has something to do with her beliefs. The girl must be wed, even if she's dead.
Did you find her?
Yes. Martha tried to turn her into a mummy. I almost got her back, but they caught me flat-footed. I had to retreat or they would've killed me.
You did what you could. Still, you haven't brought the body back, as we agreed. Leave the advance. I'd rather go to the police.
I did all I could. Still, your daughter is nowhere to be found. She seems to have vanished into thin air.
Dear God, I hope that it wasn't ghouls who got her...
Or Daemons... Goodbye Madam.
I've found your daughter. Here she is. I hope you'll find peace now.
Oh, thank Heavens! Where was she?
You didn't tell me that Rebecca was adopted. Her real mother, Martha Preston, snatched the body to make her a wedding and bury her in her home.
What? Mr.Holmes, however grateful I am to you, I see no reasons for such fantasy explanation.
Believe me or not, this is what happened. I couldn't come up with it even if I wanted to.
What about her Mo...Martha?
I had no choice but to get her out of the way. They cornered me.
That's horrible. I... I'm sorry, Mr. Holmes. I wouldn't tell, anyone, I swear!
Are you scared of me?
Ye... I mean no, not at all, why should I? Here, Mr. Holmes, take your well-earned reward. I should go bury Rebecca for good. Have a nice day!
Good. What about my reward?
Of course, of course! Here, Mr. Holmes, take your well-earned reward. Have a nice day!
She wouldn't rob any more graves. I made sure of that.
That's fine, Mr. Holmes. Here, the necklace, as we agreed. I should go and bury Rebecca. Have a good day.
Trifles that shouldn't come to your attention. I did my part. I hope you'll find peace now.
I can confirm Miss Sanders was taken away by daemons.
Of course, I happens all the time! told ya.
Oh kind sir! Them daemons nearly got me, I say! My head's still spinning!
What happened?
The Daemons, they called at night, they take the dead away. I heard them wings and then they hit me in the back. I saw one but then I passed out.
Daemons?
T'Happens all the time. It's normal in the place for the dead!
Where is the grave of Rebecca Sanders?
In the closed corner of the cemetery. But she's not there, she was taken away in the sky by the Daemons. I shouldn't have seen it, I was punished.
At least they left me my keys, they were on my belly when I woke up. But why take the cart also? They don't have carts in the sky? Oh the boss won't like it! Oh, poor I.
Daemons took your cart?
Yes, I tell you. Please don't tell anyone. It's the only job I'm fit for! That's my momma said.
Bye
I've found your cart. It's over there in the far corner of the graveyard.
Really? Oh, kind sir, thank you so, so much! I'm saved, tell you!
Don't mention it.
Here, take this, kind sir. For your work, I say.
Mr. Holmes! You have to help me. There is a murder being planned!
Please! If you carry on shrieking I will be the first casualty. What is happening?
Good! I was just getting bored. What is happening?
Oh, where are my manners. I am Fanny Fletcher, and someone wants to use me as an assassin!
I was sent a poisoned pie, they want me to throw it at someone! So they die!
Slow down, please. A poisoned pie? An assassin?
Fascinating. Will there be fire-juggling dwarves?
I understand how it sounds, but listen. For the last few months I was being sent pies, and orders to throw them at people.
Pies?
Freshly baked, with vanilla! But I never so much as took a bite. Wouldn't be proper to throw a nibbled pie at someone.
Uh... undoubtedly.
So that was that for a time - I'd be sent a pie and a letter, throw the pie at someone, then be sent a schilling for my trouble. Pranks!
By today my Frou Frou got to the pie first. He gave it a lick, the poor thing, and then... Oh, why?
Most unusual indeed. All right, I shall tackle this mystery. I suppose your brought the evidence?
I have. Frou Frou is in the box. Please, be careful - I wanted to bury him in Greenmantle tonight.
A poisoned vanilla pie seems hardly worth investigating, if only to condemn the baker. I might return to your problem later.
Mr. Holmes, how can you say that?!
The letter speaks of an invitation. What sort?
There will be a celebration in the city park soon. Seats are limited, so you need a personal invite to get in!
It's so exclusive!
I'm assuming there's great significance to it?
I... honestly don't know, sir. But if it's so exclusive, what other sort of signifance do you need?
Miss Fletcher, I will need your invitation to the event.
That's out of the question! How could I just...
Assist me in the investigation of the murder you came so close to being an accessory to? Indeed, the horror.
Well, when you put it like that... Sorry for reacting that way. You weren't, of course, going to make that throw in my place.
We shall see.
...Mr. Holmes?
My apology, Miss Fletcher, no time to waste!
I'll improvise, don't you doubt that.
Be careful!

Greetings, ma'am. So this is where those wonderful vanilla pies are being made! I need to inspect the premises.
What?
As a matter of fact, I would appreciate if you informed me.
"DiMaggio Pastries", establishment date recent enough to be within a generation from a woman of your apparent age.
I would assume your father, since I would also assume DiMaggio is your family name.
You're obviously not from here, so you'll get a pass this once. Listen well, foreigner.
The DiMaggios are a family of honest businessmen, the pillar of this city. Leave, and think twice before accusing us of anything.
In that case, I shall excuse myself. Good day, ma'am.
Cazzo di idiota.
I am a ratcatcher. Naturally, I can only practice my craft if you let me in, so I suggest you do that.
Either you're the cleanest ratcatcher I've ever seen, or just asking for trouble. And that can be arranged.
Greetings, m'lady, I hear you've got a tad of an infestation in here?
Keep your voice down! Yes, yes I do, are you the great Giomatti, the ratcatcher extraordinaire?
Just so! Here to extermine every last critter that's bothering you. Can I come in?
If that hack Giomatti knew of my techniques, he'd flee the island in dishonor before calling himself "extraordinaire".
I'll show you. Can I come in?
Yes, please! Come on in. Use any means necessary, but remember two rules, ratcatcher.
First, anything you see inside stays inside. Remember who this bakery belongs to - you're bigger than a rat, won't be too hard to catch.
And the other one?
Make them suffer.
Goodbye. I shall be back with results.
Goodbye. Those pesky critters shall not soon forget this day, I assure you.
I need one vanilla pie, the freshest and the creamiest you've got.
That's a tough choice, they're all excellent! Would you like it sliced?
Under no circumstance! Give me a solid pie. I want heft.
Who are you and what are you doing in my house?!
I'm leaving
Please explain the meaning of "mother"? Her mother is Dorothy Sanders. She hired me to find her daughter!
Ah, I see. This heathen, of course, who else could it be. No, she's not. She is her foster-mother.
I'm utterly foreign to the mere details of maternity, although I have a vague idea of the concept. Would you please enlighten me?
Rebecca is my daughter. I left her to Dorothy when she was a baby.
Why did you do it?
The child was born out of wedlock. My parents wouldn't allow me to keep her. Said she was embarrasment for the family.
I'm here to bring this young lady back where she belongs. To her grave.
I can't allow you to do that. I'm her mother and she's going to stay.
You are...insane.
You'd better leave, sir. Or we will have to show you the way out.
How about twice as many?
You have no heart, Sir. Fine. Twice as many and we're good?
Enough talking. I'm taking the body, whether you like it or not.
Kay sees, I didn't want this, but if I have to, I have to.
It's not going to be any worse for her already. Maybe it will make you happier. I'm out of here.
You've made a wise choice.
Maybe I can understand you. But Dorothy and the police wouldn't. Grave robbing is a serious crime.
I see where you are leading. Would 10 Pounds be enough for your silence?
Her true mother is Dorothy, anyway. She raised her and she loved her. You can't certainly ignore that.
Yes. I've chosen her, knowing that she will raise my child well. And she did. Now it's time for Rebecca to finally return home.
She is dead! Why can't you just leave her rest in peace?
She died unwed and was buried in filthy mud. That's against our faith. Now she's married and she will rest properly in her ancestor's house.
What kind of faith is it?
My faith. Please, Sir, just leave. I don't want to harm you and I won't tell the police. Just let me be with my child, at least this way.
I'm glad we can come to an agreement.
Here. Now get out of my sight.
I'm here to help Dorothy Sanders, and that means bringing her back her daughter Rebecca. And you, grave robbers, won't stop me.
We'll see about that.
You agreed too easily. I want more.
And I want to slap your greedy face!
Thank you for your help, miss.
Good day, miss. May I disturb you for a minute?
You don't look like one of the servants... Who are you?
Did you notice anything strange in your brother's behaviour recently?
No, he was... as usual.
Do you know anyone who could wish to kill Mr. Brown?
I'm not sure... Erich was often very angry when I was sticking my nose into his business.
Wait a minute. There was a gentleman, Robert Feugen. He and Erich had several quarrels recently. The last one seemed to be very serious.
Maybe there was someone who had a disagreement with your brother?
What else do you know about Mr. Feugen?
Not much. He and Erich were members of the same club, and Mr. Feugen was the head of that club.
Do you know where the club is located?
I'm sorry, I don't know. Erich was trying to keep this secret.
Can I take a look on Mr. Brown's belongings? This could be of great help to the investigation.
Sure... Everything is in his room.
Thank you.
You have my deepest condolences, miss Brown.
Oh, thank you. I... I have no idea how to live with this.
Miss Brown, may I ask where did you get this and where is the pistol from this case?
Mr. Holmes, you can't seriously be ransacking my room!
This was necessary for the investigation, Miss Brown. Do you know where is the pistol now?
Have no idea! Maybe Erich took it. Leave my house. Now please.
This is a gift from Erich. He even taught me to use it a bit...
Miss Brown, I think you've killed your brother, Mr. Erich Brown.
How can you!? He was my brother.
Let's start from the instrument of crime.
I found a case from the revolver in your room. The missing revolver from it can be the murder weapon.
I-It's just an empty case... Nothing else.
You also had an opportunity to kill Mr. Brown. You were at the ruins.
Mr. Feugen noticed an extraordinary scent in the Old Ruins. I bet he'll recognize the scent of the ointment you're using.
Please, stop this, Mr. Holmes.
Finally, you had a motive to kill your brother.
Mr. Brown was a tyrant. And the fact that he broke your engagement was the last drop of your patience.
I don't understand what this is about.
A murder is a murder anyway, Miss Brown. You're arrested for the murder of Mr. Erich Brown. I'm going to take you into police custody.
You have no heart, Mr. Holmes. Some day it'll hit you.
I understand you, Miss Brown. It's a pity that your life was poisoned by your brother.
This truth will be our secret. You deserve your freedom.
Oh, thank you, Mr. Holmes.
Were you beaten by your brother, Ms. Brown?
No... what are talking about? I'm just a bit clumsy, I'm afraid. I fell from the stairs.
You're unconvincing, Ms. Brown. Your bruises are on different stages of healing, which means you are constantly getting new ones.
Are you clumsy enough to fall from the stairs twice a week?
He didn't want to! I was just making him angry sometimes...
So that's how it is.
I'm sorry, I don't understand what are talking about.
Miss Brown, seems that you are using this ointment quite often. Can you name the real source of your bruises?
This is not right...
Your brother did this to you?
He didn't want to! I was just making him angry sometimes...
Wait a minute... You were in my room?! The thing you did is unworthy behavior for gentleman. Please, leave now.
Miss Brown, I found this letter among your belongings. You lost a fiance due to your brother, am I right?
He had no right to do this!! We loved each other! Still love...
Wait a minute. How dare you enter my room without my permission!? Leave. Now!
Your accusations are not valid! Go away or I'll call the police!
Hey, I've got some news for the boss.
He's upstairs at his office. Get in and faster.
Where do you think you're going, uniform?
I'm on the investigation. And I need to get in.
And I want to become the Prince of Wales. And also punch your face.
Oh hi Tommy.
Hi Boss. I need the crucial info about mass murders.
No problem, here you go!
I'll come back later.
Do what you came for, murderer! But I won't stop resisting, mind my word.
Mr. Robert Feugen, I suppose? My name is Sherlock Holmes and I'm investigating the murder of Erich Brown.
Why do I need to believe you?
If I came to kill you, why are you still alive?
Fair point.
Why did you call me a murderer?
It was you who killed Erich. I know what you want to do and I won't let you harm other club members. I'm your man. Just finish what you started!
I did not do what you think. My name is Sherlock Holmes and I'm investigating the murder of Mr. Brown.
Please, tell me your version of the events in the Old Ruins.
You... Someone killed Erich with one shot from the wall.
I can't be mistaken, I'm the best blind duelist in the Club, my hearing is perfect.
Did you see the murderer?
No. But I remember that specific scent - he left the strong floral smell. It was definitely not local.
You and Erich had several loud quarrels recently. Why?
It's the club matters, nothing special. Actually we were friends.
I'd like to speak with the other duelist.
I bought him a ticket and he's on his way home now. I won't let you accuse him of what he didn't do.
Stay still and I won't kill you. I will let you go If you leave this place and swear never to get close to any of the club members.
May I ask you several questions?
Why do I need to believe you?
You have a revolver.
Hm. Fair point. I'm listening.
Mr. Feugen, I accuse you of Mr. Erich's Brown murder.

This could be only the Butcher! The murderer from the newspapers!
You say you came home in the morning. Where have you been at night?
Ehm... My mother is old and needs care. So sometimes master allowed me to leave the house till morning.
That's all for now.
Poor master... What a monster could kill such a genius?
I was in the basement and saw things that demand your explanations.
Basement?... But... We have no basement!
Your master was the one whom newspapers call the Gollanza Butcher. The parts of his victims are still there.
I... I don't know what are you talking about! My master was killed by the Butcher!
You were accomplices, worked together. You admired him, shared his artistic taste that turned into madness. You were happy to assist the genius.
Stop saying this, officer! I didn't do anything!
You were sewing for him. He could do miracles with the stone but failed to cope with the needle.
And you tried to burn the book with a key when you found the body. Quite silly, but you were stressed to see your beloved master in such a state.
I didn't kill anyone. He did all by himself.
Oh, now you speak. I know you didn't. But you helped to cover him. You were an accomplice.
I helped the genius to create a masterpiece. I was ready to give him anything he needed, to do all he' ask.
You can arrest me now. I've lost my raison d'etre when he died. Maybe I'll be hanged, but I hope you'll hang me next to his murderer.
Your assistance is needed once more. I need you for the investigative experiment.
Experiment? What do you mean?
Sorry, but you'll have to go to the crime scene with me. I want to reenact the crime, but need someone who knew where the victim's belongings were placed.
If it will help you to catch the murderer, I'll do what I can.
You told me all those horrible things, but why? I can't understand...
I wanted to see how you'll react. We're standing in front of the most gruesome scene I've ever seen, but you don't faint or even get pale.
It's obvious you've seen such things many times before.
I didn't! That's...
Wait a bit, I have to check one thought...
I have great news for you, lieutenant! The Gollanza Butcher case can be closed once and for all!
Did you get him? Tell me you've got him!
Nicola Paoli was a Butcher himself. He murdered women and sew their bodies in a grotesque statue.
Impossible! Do you have any proofs?!
All his basement is a collection of proofs. Just go and visit it yourself.
But who killed Paoli then?
Your man did it. He avenged his wife's death.
Popandopulos! It can't be! I trusted him!
He could be understood, but the way he did it... His mind is damaged now, I believe.
It is a mystery yet to be uncovered.
Well, the Butcher is dead anyway. I should think of how to tell the public about it.
By the way, you should know that the Butcher had an accomplice.
His servant. She didn't kill anyone but helped him to stitch the bodies.
I'll send men to arrest her immediately!
Who's that?
You did well, Sherlock. Thank you.
I guess I'm done with this case.
I found you, young lady. Your fiance is in dispair, he's waiting for you.
I have no idea who you are, but I won't return to him. I don't love him. The sea is calling me.
You may tell him that I died. Jumped off a bridge for example. I don't care.
So... I see you found your dream. Have a good journey, then. I'll take care of your fiance.
Thank you, sir. You are among those few who understands me!
Stop this nonsense and come with me. I'll bring you back to your fiance.
I won't go anywhere. And if you'll try to touch me, those sailors will brake your legs.
Go away. I must prepare for the sailing.
Don't you see we're closed?
What a mess! Some people don't know when they should stop, don't they?
Just like those sailors yesterday. How could several men do so many losses?
Are you going to take this to the court?
Huh, it would last long enough for them to leave the island. No, my friends are explaining to them how to behave properly. They stole the relic, after all.
You mean you already got them? That's quite fast.
I have different customers and some owe me a favour. Yes, those sailors were met and taken... to be guarded by the elephant.
Excuse me?
If you'll come here more often, you'll know what I mean. I see you are... promising.
What relic? The one your bar is named after?
Yes, the helmet of the last hospitaller. It was kept here for a hundred years only to be stolen by drunkards? They even don't remember where they left it!
Maybe I can help you to find it?
If you will, mister, I'll owe you a favour.
I found a helmet that looks like the one you've lost. Is it the lost relic?
By good heaven, it is one! Impressive, mister...
Holmes. Sherlock Holmes, to your service.
I, Gerar Ducasse, owe you a favour, Holmes. This helmet is very dear to all my visitors... except the stupid asses like...
You shouldn't be so angry about them, Gerar. Not everyone can cope with the antique demon of bibulosity!
As my favour, maybe you can just let them go?
You are truly a generous soul, Sherlock! And as it is your favour, go do it yourself. Here's the chip - put it in the slot near the elephant in the basement.
Oh, that's what you meant by mentioning the elephant before.
But tell them they are forbidden to appear here anymore. This place is not for the pigs like them!
Hello barman! I need some information.
I don't know you pal, you better go sniffing somewhere else.
Hi there! I'm looking for my old fellas. Maybe you can help?
Sure buddy. I'm all ears.
Do you know something about drowned or missing sailors?
Ships come and leave all the time. There have been lots of "missing" sailors here these days. Do you have anyone in particular?
Nah! Just some poor fellas. They were found drunk and drowned.
I know nothing about it, but i can keep my ears open for a small price.
Agreed! Send a message by this address if you find anything.
Richard Colton?
Let us out! How dare you keep the British Navy sailors locked!
You have mistaken me with your captors, doctor, while in fact, I'm here to free you. Sherlock Holmes, to your service.
Doctor Colton... but you seem to know my name. Have we met before, mister Holmes?
No, doctor. It's your wife's attempt to find you that brought me here. And we should leave now.
The barman wants you to stay away from his tavern. He won't sue you for the damage done, but don't come here again.
The damage... If it comes to the court, he'd explain why he kept us under lock!
Leaving this quarrel behind would be a wiser choice. Let's move already. I bet all of you want to clean a throat after such a night.
You are perfectly right, mister Holmes!
I sneaked in quietly, but there are some tough goons upstairs. Do you have any ideas about getting out?
There is a door here that leads to the catacombs. I'm sure we can escape through it.
We used them to get out of the barracks secretly. I can bet I'll lead us out in no time.
Are you sure we won't end up caught in a trap?
You sound quite confident, doctor. Fine! Let's go then.
Mr. Holmes, your help here would be most welcome.
Okay. What happened here?
Mr. John Smith was apparently kidnapped. His brother, Mark is right there in the kitchen. He reported the crime.
I've found evidence that confirms this, but no eyewitnesses. Also, apparently, John Smith hasn't been a very public person.
I hope you won't mind me take a look?
That would be fantastic.
Officer Placido, I thought you're on watch in the docks.
I was, but this incident made me leave that post. By the way, if you need some news from the port you may ask me. I'm almost native there already.
You are often working in the docks, officer, maybe you heard something about the ship named "Arabella"?
Surprisingly, yes. "Arabella" is a ship from Spain, it was scheduled to arrive last evening but it was delayed.
She arrived half an hour ago - they were starting to land their cargo just when I left my post this morning.
Thank you.
I think I'm ready to tell you what exactly happened here and who's guilty.
I'm listening, Mr. Holmes.
I found this threatening letter in the victm's room. Seems that Mr. Smith had several foes that came here on "Arabella".
I recommend you to check the crew of the ship.
Thnak you. Everything becomes so easy when you take the case.
Actually there was no kidnapping at all. Mr. John Smith died long ago and his brother Mark lived under his identity.
The game became too expensive and he decided to create this kidnapping to finish it.
Sounds... Impressive. I didn't expect such a twist. Thank you, we'll arrest Mr. Mark Smith immediately.
Mr. Mark Smith, I presume? Hope you don't mind me asking a few questions?
Of course not. I hope you can find my brother.
You were the one to report the crime, right?
Yes. I decided to visit my brother and... This is just horrible!
Things were scattered, some awful scratches wee near the entrance and John was nowhere to be found. I went to police immediately.
Did you touch anything?
No, I was waiting here all this time.
I noticed you have a fresh cut on your index finger. Where did you get it?
This? I was very nervous after coming here and I cut it when I shaved.
You shaved after finding the crime?
Yes, but without leaving the first floor. I hope it's not a problem?
Probably not.
Thank you. That's all for now.
You are lying to us, Mr. Smith. There was no kidnapping here.
By heavens, are you accusing me of something?
Seems that you really did nothing bad... I'll play along. Lets say this really was a kidnapping.
And, unfortunately, no one will ever find Mr. John Smith.
Yes... Thank you!
What is that supposed to mean?
You have lived a life as John Smith using this disguise and connections. But, it seems, that something pushed you to drop that persona and escape. What was it? Debts?
Yes. You're wrong with one thing, though, mister Holmes. John is not a persona, he was my brother. But he was lost a long time ago, not today.
Perhaps, you should've tried to not lose yourself either, mister Smith. But that chance is gone now.
Please, don't pass me to the police. I did nothing bad, you already know that. There was no crime, no one died or so...
I just want other people to remember John as a good man, that's all. If you pass me, everything will be uncovered and his reputation will be ruined.
You are a fraud, Mr. Smith. I'm afraid, this is a crime anyway.
I did what I could, John. Forgive me.
Have you lost something?
Mr. Holmes, please! Don't open it.
And why is that?
This is... private. I'll pay you for your silence!
Deal. But you'll have to give a substantial sum to silence me.
Of course!
Seems that this case will stay unsolved. Goodbye.
Don't dare to offer me a bribe! I'll solve this case and you won't stop me.
Good day constable!
Good day!
Mr. Holmes I assume?
Nice guess.
Thank you!
Constable Davis told me about you. Body is there, you might take a look.
I've rolled over body from pool. That was it.
Was anything touched at the death scene?
So what is your conclusion Mr. Homes?
This sailor is not a victim of "Mermaid". This is not even a murder, it is deadly accident.
Exactly as I thought. Natural selection in action.
Good day constable.
Oh, mr. Holmes! Your camera and my clear instructions bring magnificent results!
Now my sister in London can see Gollanza beauty with her own eyes!
And i did my part - you can pick a piece of furniture for your second room!
A sofa seems a proper place to smoke a pipe or two in comfort.
Having a drink sounds nice
Rolling balls is my hobby!
Excellent choice! And i add some extra, for the memory.
Enjoy your welcome and keep your camera safe - Gollanza has many wonders to capture!
Going on a trip, Miss?
Ah, detective. Well, actually I'm leaving for good. This place brought me nothing but sorrow.
I found this case in your room. There was a revolver in it - that is before you dropped it at the crime scene.
I can also prove you were at the crime scene at the time of the murder.
I don't appreciate you snooping around here, detective. But since you have, you must have noticed that Erich was obsessed with guns. They are all over this house - my room included.
I've made some progress with the case. Thought you would be interested.
Oh, have you found the culprit?
I believe I have. In fact, I'm talking to her right now.
What? Are you out of your mind?
I have every reason to believe you killed Erich. Here's how you did it.
This proves you had an instrument of crime.
I can also prove you were at the crime scene at the time of the murder.
Absurd! This proves nothing!
And you believe him? He'll say anything to clear himself of suspicion!
Mr. Feugen, another member of the dueling club, smelled a strong floral scent at the duel. Your ointment fits his description.
Finally, you had a strong motive to kill your brother.
Can't deny you were there, can you?
Finally, you had a strong motive to kill your brother.
I'm not sure I follow your logic, Mr. Holmes.
You are right. Living with Erich was... a nightmare. I can't bear to think of it, let alone discuss it with a stranger.
You wanted to be rid of Erich. He treated you harshly and stood in the way of your happiness.
And that's exactly why you killed him.
What nonsense! You can't be serious.
Go on then. Turn me in, if that's what you want.
That's enough! Leave me. Take your theories elsewhere.
Welcome, welcome to my shop! Please, look around and tell me what you like.
Perhaps you are looking for finest Persian silk? Or fanciest Italian garbs? Whatever you need, I have it or my name isn't Rozitta Trapollo!
I need to buy...
Please, I am all ears.
How wonderful! You see, sometimes a woman walks by my store. She is sad and hunched, kept down by all of her earthly troubles.
Suddenly, something catches her eyes. It can be a cheerfull color, an intriguing pattern or a pleasent shape. She stops, and smile forms on her tired face.
I cherish those smiles. I live and work for them. Because that's a moment when I know - soon, there will be one less sad face in Old Town.
That looks like a very fulfilling way of life, ms. Trapollo. I can say that I envy you a bit.
Oh, mister, you make me blush again! Let's get back to your story. Tell me, what can I sell you to make you smile?
I just need it.
Hm, fine. There is really no reason for me to refuse a customer, but it will be double my usual price. Maybe this will dissuade you from messing with those people.
Here you go, ms. Trapollo. Unfortunately, I have no other option.
You want what?! Why on earth would you like to be dressed like those thugs?!
I am quite in a rush right now. Maybe some other time.
Oh, I... I understand. Back to business then. Please, tell me what your heart desires.
I need those clothes to infiltrate bandits hideout, and to find people, responsible for killing a local priest, because local police is too afraid to act.
Oh, if you didn't want to tell me the truth, you could have just said so! Here, take these clothes. Just... be carefull, okay?
Having this costume would make me really-really happy...
Oh, you rascal, know how to make a lady help you... Fine, here is everything you need.
No, no, keep your money and just be carefull, okay? Those people are not forgiving type.
It seems you really like your job, ms. Triapollo. It's very admirable.
Oh, you flatter me! But yes, yes, of course I do. May I tell you a little story?
I need those clothes to infiltrate bandits hideout, and to find people, responsible for killing a local priest, because local police is too afraid to act.
Oh, if you didn't want to tell me the truth, you could have just said so! Here, take these clothes. Just... be carefull, okay?
I just need it.
Hm, fine. There is really no reason for me to refuse a customer, but it will be double my usual price. Maybe this will dissuade you from messing with those people.
Here you go, ms. Trapollo. Unfortunately, I have no other option.
Having this costume would make me really-really happy...
Oh, you rascal, know how to make a lady help you... Fine, here is everything you need.
No, no, keep your money and just be carefull, okay? Those people are not forgiving type.
I want to know what happened. Perhaps I can help you to solve this gruesome murder.
Ask then. But I should warn you - it's a cold case.
Fine, officer. I'll continue the investigation.
Good luck.
Do you know who is the victim?
Did he have enemies?
Pater Alexandro Bulitti, a local priest. He lived on this street.
As far as I know, everyone loved him - or at least he didn't complain.
I see. I should look for the traces myself.
Someone butchered him, stole the cross. It happens here from time to time. Maybe some convict...
If you wish.
Did you find something on the crime scene?
Mister Holmes? Ehm... nice to meet you. Do you need anything?
Good day, officer.
It could not stay unnoticed. Killing a man who doesn't want to die is usually loud. Have the neighbours seen the murder?
They say they saw and heard nothing.
What a crude lie!
They won't tell anything to us. That's why I consider the case to be cold. Whoever did this the locals won't assist the police in capturing him.
Well, well. I'll try to find a key to their tongues.
I've inspected the crime scene and I think I have a suspect.
That's remarkable, Mr Holmes! Care to enlight me about your findings?
I've inspected the body and gathered some evidence. The sailors saw a man leaning to the body - some soldier, they say.
A soldier?
A man dressed as a soldier, let's say so. I think he wanted to rob the priest and waited for him upstairs.
He attacked the priest and chased him here before launching the fatal blow.
Brilliant attention to the details, Mr Holmes! We'll start looking for him, but without any descriptions, it will be hard.
Search the soldiers. The murderer took a heavy silver cross from the victim's body.
That should ease our search a lot! Thank you, Sherlock!
You're welcome, officer.
The locals are silent because they are afraid, officer. I think the local bandits did it.
The locals? I don't think so...
There were two of them waiting for him. One was even sharping his knife. Do you think nobody paid attention?
It's Gollanza, Mr Holmes. Things like this are usual, you know.
So you think it's a reason to neglect your duties?! Does Lt. Placido think the same?
So you are "the local" too. Fine. I'll continue the investigation myself. Can I at least hope you'll arrest them?
I'd rather avoid doing this. This gang is the real power in Old Town, and they do not forget, do not forgive.
Mr Holmes! I can't tell you to stop, but don't drag me into this! I have a family, I know what can they do! The Red Scarves are horrible men, I swear!
If you are so afraid, just tell me where to find them.
I won't. You are mad if you want just to go there. I don't want to help you to die, Sherlock.
That will just make the things a bit more complicated.
And what we got here? A stunning lady for the hungry stalion! You came to visit me, darling?
Did you wait for me, handsome? I have a surprise for you...
Oh, I can't wait to see what it is.
I'm not a woman.
Haha! Okay, okay, you have a sense of humor! I like you. What do you want, not-a-woman?
I beg your pardon, but can we go strait to the point? I'm Sherlock Holmes and I need those two criminals.
Ha! You decided to start a masquerade just to talk with me? Very interesting! And what do you want to do with them?
I'm investigating the murder of the priest. And these two men are guilty of that. They're going to face justice.
And that's all? Pff, I won't stop you. My boys will throw them away from here and you can do whatever you want.
You may arrest, kill them or make them dance a tapdance all day long.
This makes my task easier. Thank you for cooperation.
Whatever! Just go away till I'm in the good mood.
A lady! Clever, heh.
I'm intrigued. Why don't you care about the members of your gang?
Oh, they killed the priest, you said it yourself. They're not my people anymore after that. You see, I'm a pious man, I'd never ordered to kill the holy father.
And these bastards killed him! Maltida sea!
Yes, he robbed us, but I'm sure he'd use all those goods to help the needy. He'd say a paryer for my soul!
I'm afraid now I can't leave until all your gang is still exsisting.
And why it always ends like this?! Fine, try it.
I know that you were the one who poisoned poor journalist
Wha... what are you... that's not true!
Here is my proof...
That's enough to make a solid case. Constable! Constable, over here! Don't do anything stupid, please. It's all done now.
Your motive is...
I can prove that you were at the crime scene...
There were only 4 types of prints at the Crime Scene. Two were policemen boots, one belonged to the victim and the last perfectly matches your size.
That means nothing!
You smoke Red Devil Cigars, which leave very distinctive ash trace, this trace was all over the hidden alcove were you've burned victim's research.
I know nothing of no research. And half of the island smokes this cigars!
Harold was about to uncover a big smuggler's ring, which involved many bakers at the Old Market. You clearly did no want this story to be published.
That's... crazy! I am an honest trader!
You also had means of poisoning victim. There are dozens of sweet cinnamon cakes at your stall. It would have been quite easy for you to sell him one of them... With a little extra inside.
Nonsense! I would never sell poisoned goods to anyone! One word of it would ruin me!
Your weapon was...
You seem to be in trouble, mister.
Oh, mister, I am! What is this punishment for? How could that happen? All my kiosk disappeared and everybody pretends they don't know what happened!
What goods did you sell?
Sweets, the best sweets on the island! My locum was served in rich houses! And my candies...  everyone knew Osman Zamir's candies!
Perhaps the police may help to find your property.
The police? No way they'll even scratch to do something! All the bazaar is illegal for them!
Maybe you have enemies? Or any guess who could do this?
Enemies? My neighbour Salim is a damned thief and the nephew of my wife promised to kill me twice... but to steal my kiosk? No way!
Did this happen before with someone else?
The bandits we pay to usually stop such things. I can't even imagine why they could allow this to happen now!
Do you think there could be witnesses?
Plenty of them! But everyone refuses to talk to me! I'm in despair, mister. My wife will throw me in the sea from the fort wall if I'll do nothing!
It seems you need some help to get out of this tricky situation. I, Sherlock Holmes, can do you such a favour.
God bless you, Mr Holmes! I'll reward you with all I can afford if you'll find my kiosk!
Damned beggar, how could he dare to steal from me! I'll burn his dirty hole! I'll beat him until my stick breaks!
A local cadger Vageez took them to repair his hut after the kiosk was robbed.
I found the remaining parts of your kiosk.
Where are they?
Pig! Freak! Damn him and his father who made such a bastard! Huh... huh... Damn! Shaitan take them! Huh...
Are you okay?
Huh... I'm fine, fine. I'll just go to the police and tell them about this worm.
Hush, hush, no need to be so fierce. The thieves threw them all over the street, so he just gathered them.
Huh... Fine, fine. I'll just come and take what's mine. Won't even beat him. Probably.
Only one plank on the road, nothing more.
Will you tell me about each plank you'll find now?
This one was special. I believe it can lead us to the villains.
I found the boxes with the sweets. But you should not hurry to take them back.
What? Why? Where are my goods?
You'll find them on the piers. A kind fisherman agreed to look after them.
But how my sweets ended up there?
The sailors took them from the robbed kiosk. Ate some and gave a bit to local boys, but most of your goods are safe.
Dirty pigs! They ate my precious locum and gave it to those urchins! For free!
Those men were from "Le Monde" ship crew. Heavily drunk, by the way. And their ship is leaving tomorrow.
Do you think their captain may give me compensation?
Not sure, but they'll be definitely punished.
That's fine too. I'll go there as soon as we finish here.
Consider this to be a payment for keeping it safe. Other thieves would carry the boxes away so you'd never get them back.
Huh... Maybe that's true. All the bazaar is full of thieves! I... I guess I'll just take my locum back...
That's a wise decision, Mr Zamir.
The kiosk was robbed by a group of bandits before sailors and poor men came.
Bandits? But I pay them for protection, like everyone on this bazaar! Maybe they are from some other gang?
I guess it's time to talk with those you pay to.
I'm... I'm afraid. What if they beat me or even kill? Red Scarves are sometimes... unpredictable.
I'll go. Just tell where to find them.
In the yard, behind the ark next to the yellow shield on the wall, close to the pharmacy. The one I pay to has a mangled left ear.
Can you recognise this sign? I found it on the remnants of your kiosk.
I don't draw it, I swear!
Sure you did not. But maybe you have seen it on the other kiosks? I found one on the kiosk nearby, but it was erased.
On Abdulla's shop? That's strange... he had some conflict with Red Scarves, but I thought it was settled!
I'll go then. Don't lose hope, Mr Zamir.
Who the hell are you!?
Go easy, you don't want the tea-house guys to notice you are here, don't you?
Oh... let's talk this private...
You knew about the risks, Abdula. You framed Osman and you have to pay for that.
No... You are with them! I should have guessed...
I'm the one who knows about your drawings in the night and your debts. You are in a deep... swamp, Abdula.
I had to! I'd never manage to pay the debt and I need to sell this kiosk as soon as possible!
So that was your plan? Osman won't be glad to learn about this, you know. Tell me a single reason to let you go with that.
I wanted all that to stop. Those bandits, they just take our money and no one did anything to stop them!
I bribed the police so they were arrested, and not a single man on the bazaar helped me. Those rascals even refused to be witnesses!
And now the gang wants revenge.
Yes. I have to save myself and I need money. Please!
Go on then, I won't interfere. Sell your kiosk and flee. Good luck.
Allah bless you, mister!
I came to talk about Osman Zamir's kiosk. Do you know it was robbed thrice this night?
Who are you and why didn't Zamir come himself?
He's afraid. His kiosk was marked by this sign - I guess you recognise it? And I'm... well, a friend. Sherlock Holmes.
Our sign? What the hell? Zamir is a good man, he pays and doesn't argue about it! It must be a mistake and someone is gonna pay for that!
His kiosk, perhaps. I permit you to do anything with it, but remember - it's your friend's compensation.
I'll try to find him. Maybe you have a clue to start from?
Let me guess - your men marked Abdulla Khayam's kiosk to be robbed.
You know too much for the British. Yes, we have some misunderstandings with Abdulla.
Your men did not mistake.  I guess Abdulla just erased the sign from his kiosk and drew the same on Osman's.
That won't save him from paying debts!
But it can gain him time.
You have guts to talk about this so frankly. But I agree to give you an opportunity to help your friend.
I thought you could arrange it between yourself. Why do you need me for that?
You know about Abdulla Khayam already, don't you? Catch him, and I'll give his kiosk to Osman. Lure this rat out of his hideout!
So you recognise the mistake. Don't you think Zamir deserves a compensation of some kind?
That's enough to say he didn't pay even when he could. I told you what to do if you want to help your friend.
What will you do to him if I succeed?
We won't kill him if you care about that.
Why do you pursue Abdulla? What has he done?
Step right up, sir! Don't be shy. Fancy taking part in the Twins Contest?
Sure, what are the rules?
Then, you'll need to dress up exactly the same using the wardrobe over there. Fear not, there's plenty of clothes to choose from.
The rules are quite simple. You'll have a quick peek at a wax figure of a notable local, courtesy of our famous Madame Rousseau museum.
It's a local tradition that goes back to the ancient Greeks. I won't bore you with the details. Suffice to say, we take it very seriously.
Dressing up to imitate wax figures? Who on earth thought that up?
Sounds like fun.
You bet! The Twins Contest is held all over Gollanza. Besides, best impersonators move up to the big league.
The fee to compete is a 100 pounds. If you win, you get double back. You lose, and I get to keep half of it. So, are you in?
Splendid! Just remember, you have only 10 seconds to look at the figure.
All right, I'm in.
I think I'll pass, thanks.
Suit yourself. Do come back if you change your mind.
Can you go over the rules please?
Sure thing! You need to dress up exactly the same as a wax figure you'll see on stage. Our wardrobe is at your disposal.
The fee to compete is a 100 pounds. If you win, you get double back. You lose, and i get to keep half of it. So, are you in?
Welcome back, sir! So, have you made up your mind?
All right, I'm in.
Splendid! Just remember, you have only 10 seconds to look at the figure.
I think I'll pass, thanks.
Suit yourself. Do come back if you change your mind.
So, how do I look?
Wow, your disguise is perfect! You are a natural! Here's your 200 pounds well-earned. Make sure you visit other contest locations as well.
So, how do I look?
Well, this won't do. Won't do at all. Something is clearly wrong. Here's half of your deposit. You can try again later, if you like.
I wish to withdraw from the contest.
