I do indeed. Let me tell you what happened.
Some of the Sacred Garden priests ate bad fruits and got sick. I talked to their priest and he will punish them for the threats. I can promise you that you won't hear from them again.
Oh thank you, mister! I was afraid some crazy weirdos from Grand Saray were involved. I can trust Sacred Garden priest, he's doing some good for this community.
I will make sure to tell my friends how good the Elites are. And say hi to that charismatic officer from your office from me. He used to love my lemonade, but I haven't seen him around lately.
I'm sure he won't be able to resist the call of your wonderful lemonade forever, madam.

Sacred Garden Spring dried out and was filled with polluted water on accident. The Priest was afraid to reveal it for the sake of the community, but some of his people got sick and blamed you instead.
Oh this is horrible! I'm sure that the priest's heart was in the right place, but this lie was inexcusable... But I know him,those who threatened me will be punished.
You were extremely efficient. I will make sure to tell my friends how good the Elites are. And you should come drink my lemonade more often! You'll love it!
Thank you, madam. It was my pleasure to help.
May I hope that you'll tell me willingly where's the stolen book?
I won't tell you or these bastards a single thing about that book!
Very well.
I have everything I wanted to know. Thank you.
What is wrong with you, weirdo.
Oh, mister. I saw she gave you a badge. You know what does it mean? Now you are in the Game.
Wait what?
Collect as much as you can and you'll participate in our elections. Only a good and helpful person can be ours Capo, even if he is not a child.
In any case, I have to arrest you.
You made this ruins your home, so you had ample oppurtunities to place posters. And you are clearly going against the norms and rules of society, so you have the motive.
I assure you, brother, you are mistaken. But, we are peaceful people, and we don't want no trouble. We surrender.
Nothing for now.
Go with piece, friend.
About your camp here...
Yes, brother?
Soon workers will come to turn this place into a museum. You can stay and make sure they respect the Nature. Just tell that Governor's Elite allowed it.
That's a tremendous news, brother! Oh, we were truly blessed when we found this sanctuary. Now we can do some Nature's work.
You have to leave this ruins. Armed people are going to come here tomorrow to finish construction, and you will not be welcome.
That's horrible! Just horrible! Where are we to go? What will happen to this nature's blessed place?
Oh, you bring bad tidings, friend. We will gather our things and leave today. I hope Mother Nature will look kindly upon us and gifts a new shelter.
Excuse me sir, but who are you?
You can call me brother Blackthorn. And these are my brothers and sisters, united in love for Nature. We are Her children, and she is our Mother.
What are you all doing in here?
We were called to this ruins to protect and preserve Nature creations.
Called by whom?
Why, by Nature herself! We saw a lonely red buzzard, falling from the sky, as if shot by a despicable hunter. We ran to help and found this place.
There are a lot of violent posters in this ruins. Perhaps, you know who placed them?
You are talking about these abominations, created from the bones and ashes of nature's beatifull children?
We know nothing of them and want nothing to do with them. Ruins are big, and there are always those, who wish to abuse our Mother.
Welcome, brother, to our humble shelter! Come, join us, share a sip of water and a bite of food.
Our stock is not very diverse, we only have what earth provides us, but what ours is yours.
That's all for now.
Nature's blessing upon you, brother.
In any case, I have to arrest you.
It's obvious you had opportunity to place posters. You also clearly have no love for our government and have a lot to say about it.
You... what... how dare you! I fought for this country, I protected it, while aristocratic swines like you got fat and rich back at London!
This will not end well for you all... No it won't!
About your camp here...
What about it, lackey?
Nothing for now.
Yeah, sure.
I am afraid you have to leave. Armed people will come tomorrow, and you really don't want to stand in their way.
Well, slap my ass and call me Sally! They took my best years away from me and they came back for more. Fine, you win for now, lackey!
Workers are going to come tomorrow and start reconstruction. You have no work, no place to stay - maybe you can join them? It can be a new beginning for you.
What?! Are you asking me to work for some pompous aristocrat on his...
Hmm... Actually, that's not a bad idea... That is an amazing idea! I'll do it, sure, sure.
That's all for now.
Yeah, yeah...
Excuse me sire, can you answer few questions?
What? Who? Ah, I see, you are a governor's lackey... Sure, ask whatever you want, lackey.
How can I address, you, sir?
Don't sir me, lackey. My name is Benjamin, and I am just an old war veteran. Yeah-yeah, don't give me that look, I don't need your pitty, and I am sure as hell don't need your respect.
What are you doing here?
Can't you see, lackey? I live here. Ain't no other place for me on this island. Ain't no place for the likes of me in the whole Empire.
Do you know who is placing anarchist's posters around here?
What do I care about some papers? But I'd say they do a damn good job. Those rich hyennas in power need a proper shake-up!
If you think I have something to do with it - forget it. I have enough on my hand with trying to survive. Ask those flower children or whatever they call themselves.
Karem's lair is here. Thank you Mr. Holmes that you agreed to snatch out my poor girl from his grasp!
How many people does he have?
Well, the thing is she was not abducted by force, rather fell victim to his criminal charm.
So you want me to talk or to fight?
More than enough to cause troubles.
Wouldn't it be better to ask the police for help?
I am afraid, that talking wont do any good, at least for as a start.
Maybe Karem will talk, if you manage to get to him.
Just try not to kill his people. Of course, I will testify of your self-defence to police, but you won't get respect from Karem. And he has a thing about respect.
And the governor advised me to talk to that Karem. To talk, bah! His brutes wont even let me in!
Are you lost, beauty?
I have a business with Karem, not his lapdogs. Go and call him. Now.
I am here to see honorable Karem, on behalf of british merchant union of Gollanza
Karem has no business with british scum. Lets play with him, Rollo!
I ll tell him that one more came for a beating. Stay here, sweety.
You seem to have keen eyesight, mister. Will you help me in my experiment?
Not this time.
Why not. What do you want me to do?
Now I'm testing my new urban disguise and I need someone like you to understand how effective it is.
Please, count to ten and try to find me on this square.
Okay. I'm starting to count.
You're not so attentive as I thought... Or my disguise is really, really good.
You're right, you managed to trick me and it's not an easy task, I may say.
Perfect!
Ooh...
Actually, I played along. I've noticed you from the very beginning. Just didn't want to upset you.
Now I want to test another type of disguise. The rules are the same: count to ten and try to find me on this square.
Let's go.
Uh-oh... Ouch!
Do you hear me? I know you're there, get out.
There's no one here. You're mistaken, mister.
I found you, boy.
The game is over.
You know you won't be able to move in it, right? Not the wisest choice for a disguise.
It's not for chasing. It's for observation.
Gotcha.
Sheesh.
Wow, you found me. You really have a keen eye.
Thank you, now I have some ideas about how to improve my disguise. A few months and I'll become a shadow behind your back.
Would you like to sponsor my ideas? Some resources can save me a loooot of time.
You're doing a great job, boy.
Thank you, mister! Take this as my gratitude, you could use some good piece of disguise. No offense.
I like your ideas, boy, but they don't worth my money.
Shame.
And this badge is for you. Thanks for your help!
Excuse me.
What?
Aha, I recognize you, boy!
Who you calling boy, dirtbag?!
I apologize. I mistook you for another person.
Get out of here before I hurt you.
Excuse me.
Yes?
I'm sorry, I mistaken you for another person.
That's okay.
I recognized you, boy. It wasn't hard.
Why are you calling me boy? How rude of you.
Your fake mustache lacks some additional glue.
Ouch!
You may stop pretending, I recognize you.
Wow, you are really attentive.
Okay, you got me. Now I want to test another type of disguise if you don't mind.
The rules are the same: count to ten and try to find me on this square.
Let's go.
My knowledge of chemistry is not perfect, but enough to say with certainty that her lemonade is as pure as it can be.

I... see. I was sincerely hoping that was the case, as the lady has been good to us, yet I dread to think of the alternative. We have a Sacred Spring, you see, and... I fear it might be.. compromised.
I can analyse the quality of the water there, if you wish.
That might be for the best. I will ask my trusted acolyte to open the door for you. The spring is at the back of the garden.
Hello, could you help me with something, please?
Of course, young man. What is troubling you?
I couldn't help but notice that you and your people are sick, symptoms pointing to some sort of bacterial infection. And I also know of a certain lady being called a witch over this unsubstantiated.
You... You are extremely direct, young man. I know not of accusations, but how can you be sure the lemonade is not the cause of the affliction we're suffering from?
What's going on?!
Oh no! I'm so sorry about what just happened! This proves what I feared. My acolyte has polluted the spring with his foolish actions. And only I can take the blame for trusting him...
According to my analysis, the spring water contains traces of dyes and the water usually found in fountains, not springs.
The spring... dried out. I couldn't share it with the community, they'd take it as a bad omen. My acolyte suggested redirecting the water from a nearby water source and I agreed.
But that water source may have been condemned. I should've never allowed this lie. And his threats to the lemonade stall lady, just inexcusable. How could I be so foolish and trusting.
What will you do now?
My acolyte and everyone who helped him threaten the lady will be punished, I promise you. He overstepped me once, but he still sees the father in me, he will understand and will never do this again.
I will consider it. Oh and by the way, here's a recipe for a medicine that might help your people.
But I beg of you - do not share this with anyone. The knowledge of the Sacred Spring drying out might ruin our community. I will do everything when the time is good and will take the blame.
I can see you have a conflict here. Perhaps I can help.
I'll see what I can do.
Well, I can see that you didn't even bothered to drag that man to a nearby alley. You obviously aren't afraid of the police, and you probably belive that you're right in what you're doing.
Of course! He stole from us!
Ah, now we're getting somewhere. And now I'm almost sure that I'll be able to help.
What makes you think that? Who do you think you are?
So how about you tell me what happened and perhaps I will help you.
Huh, alright. This thiefs name is Marco Cordone and he stole a book from my bookshop. Luckily my son was on his way home from the bank and he caught this dirty thief at this very spot.
But he doesn't have the book with him now. So we're trying to get him to talk while we wait for the police. Bastard probably hid it somewhere while he was running away from the bookshop.
So, use your "keen eye" to find the book, and you'll get a fair reward - more than you could sell it for. And don't try anything funny, or we'll find you and break your legs.
I can also tell that you're missing a toe, and that you know this thief, and that the person beating him is your son. I have a keen eye and that helps me in finding stolen items among other things.
What's going on here?
Why the hell do you care?
You're right, I don't care.
Pffft.
I'd like to ask you a few questions about him before I start.
Feel free to ask anything, Mr Holmes. I really need him to be found before the creditors drain us dry.
Maybe I could find some clues in his room if you allow me to see it.
I will, but don't make a mess, please.
What was your husband's profession? Did he have any business problems before disappearing?
Philip owned several ships that were freight by the pottery traders. I don't know about any problems with them.
What about meeting someone strange or suspicious? Some old friends? Didn't you notice anything strange in his behaviour?
Peter was nervous and tired last year. He didn't allow me to look through the correspondence and... I can't say our relationship was perfect.
I pay for any news about him, but only if you have proofs. And how did you know who I am, Mr Holmes? I'm sure we never met before.
Initials on the handkerchief and a trace of a wedding ring on your finger are enough to make such a conclusion.
You are very attentive, Mr Holmes. I hope you'll use your skills to find Philip.
Good day, Mrs Rivers. My name is Sherlock Holmes and I can find your husband.
I finished my investigation.
Please tell me you found something!
Good news, Edna. Your husband is alive. I can't tell you what kind of problems he met, but he'll return home soon. Here's a note from him, sealed and signed.
My goodness! You saved our family, Mr Holmes!
Be strong, Edna. I have bad news.
Have you found Philip? Is he ill? Injured? Or...
I'm afraid your husband is dead, Edna. I found his clothes near the ship cemetery. And here is a suicide note.
I think we'll never find that out. But at least it will solve your legal problems.
Oh... why? Why could he do that?
Thank you for your help, Mr Holmes. And here's the payment.
Good luck, Mrs Rivers.
I found the documents about Mr Rivers payments. It was not difficult to find out that this apiary was bought by him, Mr Lee.
Are you a police detective? If not, I don't want to discuss this any longer.
If you prefer their company, I won't insist. But think about poor Mrs Rivers and her children. They can end up on a street just because...
What? They inherited the prosperous company after Philip died!
Good day, Mr Lee.
Good day. Who are you?
I'm Sherlock Holmes, and I investigate the disappearance of Mr Philip Rivers.
How can I help you?
They didn't. Your plan went a bit wrong. Should I tell you where the flaw is?
I suppose you knew from the very beginning?
Only after I had a chance to notice your small disguise, Mr Rivers. But what's more important - what will you do now?
I faked my death to live here in peace, Mr Holmes, with only bees and flowers around.
I'm tired. I thought I left enough to my family, but now you say I have to go back?
I think your wish is quite understandable. Bees are really fascinating. So I can arrange this in your favour.
You can? I'd be so grateful!
Just wait for me to get my old jacket from the attic!
Give me some of your old personal belongings and write a suicide note. I'll witness your death and thus the legal problems will be solved.
Yes, Mr Rivers, your nice vacation seems to be over.
But how can I come back after this? What can I tell?
I think we can make it easier for you. I'll tell your wife about a mysterious danger from the past and she'll be glad to know you survived it.
I hope there won't be a lot of questions after all...
Oh, there will be a lot of them when the creditors will leave. You have to be strong and never succumb to woman's curiosity.
I'm not glad that you found me, Mr Holmes, but I appreciate your understanding. Hurry to bring Edna the good news and get your deserved reward...
Excuse me sir, but it looks like you are troubled by something.
Wha... why do you say that, mister...
Holmes. Sherlock Holmes.Well, it's quite obvious!
You are dressed in a hunting outfit, which hasn't seen much wear. You have an impressive gun, but any hunter knows it's too loud for a proper hunt.
Also, you have traces of sea salt on your boots, which would suggest a recent sea voyage. I'd guess you just came to the island.
Oh no, is all of this so obvious? I am doomed, I am trully doomed...
Ah, but sir, you are so perceptive! Would you mind helping me with an upcoming hunt?
I am afraid, I am quite busy at the moment. Maybe later.
Oh, no... There is no hope...
Tell me the details, I am happy to help a fellow gentleman.
Oh, you are saving me and my family, mister! My name is Anthony Giormo, and I am here to join the Game. It's a weekly event, which any man of proper standing can join.
You have to hunt in a Secluded Grove and come back with a trophy. But... I know next to nothing about hunting!
If that is the case, why do you even want to participate?
I come from a line of minor Italian nobility. Unfortunately, we found ourselves on the brink of poverty, and this club is my only chance to save my family!
Because of the prize, of course! Every succesfull hunter is invited to an exclusive Grand-Saray hunting club.
It's still seems strange that you would want to join such a club.
Hunting club is just a catchy name, mister Holmes. First and foremost, it's a gathering of influential gentlemen. And that's what matters these days.
What do you want my help with?
Well, you are good at noticing details. Behind us is a Secluded Grove - place of the Game. If you can find a good hunting spot for me, I would be forever grateful!
Have you tried asking local hunters?
I couldn't get much out of them- they love to boast, but get pretty secretive when it comes to potential competitors.
I am on it. Anything else I need to know?
Take this invitation, you can find more details inside.
Also, I've heard some dark rumours about the Game but... their source is Gollanza Gazette, and that's not really a reliable source. But still, watch yourself, okay?
Don't worry. I am always vigilant.
Oh, you're back! Have you come to help me?
I am still investigating, come back to you later.
Of course, I will wait for as long as needed.
I've found a good hunting spot for you, Anthony.
Hmm, it seems a bit dangerous, but I am sure I can handle it. Thank you very much Sherlock! Here, take this.
Amazing, thank you so much, mister Holmes! Here, take this!
Anthony, I don't think you should take part in the Game.
But... What, why? You don't understand, it's the only chance my family have!
Take a look at what I found...
Listen, I... I see why you have concerns, but... Trust me, when I say - I have no other way. If I don't get back home with win, I... There is no point in getting back at all.
Look at what I found, you still think it's safe to participate in the Game?
It seems you've fixated on this idea, but trust me - there is always another way for young and energetic men such as yourself.
No, no, skip the pointless flattery, you don't even know how many things I've tried. Aut cum scuto, aut in scuto - that's my only options. Help me, or leave me be.
I refuse to help you then. I don't want to have any part in your demise.
That's... I understand. Goodbye, mister Holmes. Here, take this. I owe you for trying, at least.
Fine. I will help you.
Oh, thank you so much! So, did you find a good spot for me to hunt?
Hmm, it seems a bit dangerous, but I am sure I can handle it. Thank you very much Sherlock! Here, take this.
Amazing, thank you so much, mister Holmes! Here, take this!
I've found a good hunting spot for you, Anthony.
You seem to be in distress, mister.
Distressed?! I'm appalled! Offended! Dismayed! This is an outrage! Someone dared to steal my wonderful Moby. Someone probably kissing his disgusting vermins right now!
Your dog was stolen, you say?
He denies everything! But I know! He was always jealous of our success. He's probably hiding my treasure somewhere. But I have no proof!
Your situation is quite peculiar, mister...
Yes, my magnificent Moby. The smartest, the quickest and, dare I say, most beautiful pup on this god forsaken island! Taken from me! Damn, you Ishmael! Damn you!
It seems that you have a suspect for the crime. Why not resolve this matter?
Holmes. Sherlock Holmes. I was about to suggest the same.
Pequod. Herman Dik Pequod. Mayhaps, you can help, young fellow?
I'm afraid I'm not familiar with your dog act, mister Pequod. Could you please tell me more about the dog?
And Moby? Oh, he can do everything. But our main feature is the card trick. An audience member can pick any card, I would shuffle it in and then Moby can recognize the card without mistake.
But of course! I'm not surprised you haven't heard of us. Not yet, anyway! We've just recently arrived to Gollanza after a mainland tour.
That is an interesting trick. How does it work?
Mister Holmes, this is a professional secret! And I cannot reveal it without Moby's approval.
I will find your wonderdog, mister Pequod.
Wonderful! Ishmael's tent is farther down the northern wall of the Luna Park. I will be waiting for the good news, mister Holmes!
You've mentioned one named Ishmael. Is he a suspect?
Definitely! His snakes and vermin act has never been as successful as what we have with Moby. But we often must travel together, so I have to deal with him constantly.
And you have no proof that Ishmael could've stolen the dog?
No, but he's a despicable fellow. He talks to snakes, how can you trust a man who can do that?
Good news, mister Pequod. I've found Moby!
Moby! Who's the good boy! Who's the good boy! Why do you smell of cheese so strongly?
I've found him in a pile of Swiss cheese. He seems to be incredibly fond of it.
Oh he is! But how did he get there?
I don't believe he could've run off on his own. Would you still suspect that he was stolen?
Then this case is not yet resolved, mister Pequod. I will return with more answers.
My little genius would never leave me! No, he was most definitely stolen! Abducted! Taken against his will!
I've discovered the identity of the snatcher, mister Pequod. He was arrested.
Wonderful! Who was this dastardly kidnapper? And where is Moby?!
Moby's whereabouts are still a mystery to me. But it won't remain so for long. Fret not, mister Pequod. Next time we talk I will reveal the whole story to you and bring Moby with me.
Mister Holmes! You bring good news?
This wasn't very gentleman like, Moby. Please do not do this again!
An entertainer named Ahab has arrived at Gollanza recently in his search for more performing animals. Moby intrigued him and, realizing that you won't sell him, he decided to steal him instead.
How horrible! I hope you were treated well, my little boy.
He was. However, he was left without his favorite swiss cheese. And Ahab didn't know that this particular snack was the secret ingredient of your act...
The best. I'm glad to see you home too, Moby. Now, let me tell you what happened.
A smell he followed to a little stand selling the cheese. Somehow the trader haven't even noticed how his pile of cheese got a little resident. And that's where I found him.

On the streets, Moby wanted to go back to you. But before his strong smelling ability could bring him back he got sidetracked by a different strong smell that reminded him of home - a smell of cheese.
Oh no!
Moby was not harmed. And Ahab has already been arrested.
Mister Holmes, please--
Do not worry, this will remain your tasty secret. In fact, this secret was the reason Ahab didn't just leave with Moby immediately and threw the poor dog back on the street.
Well, I still find his act quite disgusting, I'm afraid. But maybe I should stop being so suspicious. Or even better, I should leave Gollanza before another crazed person tries to kidnap Moby!
That's the adventure Moby had. Ishmael, despite your suspicions, had nothing to do with the disappearance.
But not before I thank you, mister Holmes. You've outdone everything that I've expected. And reunited me with Moby, which is the most important thing.
You're welcome.
You seem to be really good with dogs, mister Holmes. I think I have a perfect way to express my gratitude. No-no, please do not resist. I will contact you in a few days about this. Thank you!
Your shirt is new and made locally in Gollanza. Which despite your own assertion of waning fame shows that you had a chance to make money. Your cages aren't as full as they used to be as well.
You're horrifyingly perceptive, mister Holmes. Fine. I sold a couple of my animals to a travelling entertainer going by the name of Ahab.
He had the money and keen interest in performing animals and I didn't ask any questions. We traded and I never saw him again.
Did he ask anyone else in the Luna Park?
If you can write me his description down it will be of great help, mister Ishmael. Thank you. And I wish you luck with your performance act.
I don't know. But I have seen him around for a few days before he approached me. And no, I do not know where he lives and where he might be. Perhaps he left Gollanza already.
Hello, you must be Ishmael of the Scary Vipers fame?
Fame? Hah. I'm hitting the all-time low. Did Pequod send you?
As a matter of fact, he did mention you being his first suspect of Moby disappearance. But I can already see he was wrong.
Oh?
Despite your incredible tidiness, your clothes are full of rodent fur and scales. No dog fur, though. And that old bite scar on your arm. You're afraid of dogs, aren't you?
I'm not--  Afraid is a strong word, mister...
Sherlock Holmes. Do not take it in offence, mister Ishmael. I'm hoping you can share anything that can clear up the situation with Moby disappearance.
I'm not sure.
What do you think you're doing here, burro? Who let you in?
I think you may help me with a case of a missing dog. Can i ask you a couple of--
Maldita sea! Deal with this idiot!
Perhaps now you can answer some questions for me?
Dios mio! What do you want?!
Moby the wonderdog. I believe you might know what happened to him.
Kicked him out on the streets where he belongs, that useless mutt! I tried to realizar the trick with the cards. Dog can't tell mierda! Know nothing!
Perhaps you just didn't have the right touch. So you stole him, then just kicked him out of the house and decided to lay down before appropriating more animals later?
Yes, and I'm telling you nothing else!
You will tell the police. I'm sure they will have many questions.
Lieutenant Gunpowdere I presume?
Who the hell are you? You're not one of my men. Ah, you must be from the lieutenant Armstrong's brigade. So what do you want?
I have reasons to believe that you won a violin from one of your soldiers, Jeremy Jones.
Yes, I did win it. Had extremely lucky evening then. What of it?
100 Gollanza bucks.
I would like to buy it from you on behalf of my client. Name your price.
Lieutenant that gambles, drinks on the job and gets into bar fights. Not something your superiors would appreciate I imagine.
Are you threatening me? Who do you think you are?
I can keep that information to myself of cource, but I want that violin.
I don't care who and what you tell, you imbecile. But you can try of cource, but I doubt it'll be good for you.
If you want that violin you'll have to buy it, and it'll cost you. 600 for the violin or get the hell out of here.
The thing is it was not his in the first place. He stole it from his father, musician and composer.
Are you sure of that?
Yes. His father put posters all over the streets in a desperate attempt to find someone who will help him find it.
What a disgrace. I always admired artistic people, especially musicians. I can't let him suffer because of his coward of a son.
I have a brother like that. I saw what his actions did to our parents. I wouldn't wish that on anyone.
Very well, you may take the violin, it's in the safe.
Ok, 600 it is. Here you go.
Wow perhaps you are actually an idiot, if you're willing to pay 600 for the violin. All the better for me. You may take the violin, it's in the safe.
I'm not even gonna ask where did a simple sailor like yourself got that money. You may take the violin, it's in the safe.
Perfect. Here you go.
I don't think I'm gonna buy it right now.
Bye
If you want that violin you'll have to buy it, and it'll cost you. 600 for the violin or get the hell out of here.
Hey! Hey, mister! Help me! Let me out of here!
Dale Riley, I presume?
Yes, it's me! For the love of God, let me out!
Who put you in this cage?
I don't know who he is. He comes every week, brings me food and drink to prolong his torture.
I told him I'm sorry. I set Lucas up, and I'm sorry! Please, please let me out! You're my only chance.
There must be a key. It's got to be around here somewhere.
How can I let you out?
Let me open this cage for you.
Thank you a thousand times! You're my savior!
After what you did to Lucas, I think you deserve this fate.
No, please, I'm begging you, don't go!
Sorry, Dale. I'll leave you to reflect on what you've done.
Let me out of here! You're my only hope.
You said that the ritual was meant to be safe?
The text of the ritual was a hint. "At the rise of the sun - flight. The feathered one - trust. At the lowest place  - moon. With the sea's grace - honor."
I hope I will be able to find out.
This... this is horrible. Who could've done that?.. And why?
Yes. There is a chance it was luck, of course, but a more likely reason is that your "feathered one" slab was swapped with a different one. Perhaps intentionally.
Ah, so the slabs were a hint as I suspected. I'm glad my assumption was correct and jump safe.
You... You have made the jump?
Hello, my name is Sherlock Holmes. I've interest in learning more about Margarita Cliff. I believe you might know something about it?
Hello, young man. I'm Basil, the current pearl diving club leader. The Margarita?.. Ah, it was a sacred place for our club for centuries.
This sounds dangerous.
An initiation ritual was taking place there every year, where those who wanted to join the highest ranks of our club had to jump and bring back a black pearl from the sea floor.
It was meant to be. But the ritual was designed to be safe. It was a test of dedication and faith in those in your club and the sea itself. But we don't do that anymore.
Yes... Several people dared it. And died. Including my younger brother. Our oldest brother, Stavros, was the leader back then. He couldn't handle the situation. Just left one day and never returned.
As a new leader my first decision was to abolish the Margarita ritual. Nevertheless, our club numbers have been getting smaller with each year.
It stopped being safe?
Thank you for sharing this, mister Basil. I have reasons to believe that the slabs were not accidentally swapped and will try to investigate this further.
I thank your passion, young man, but the ritual will never return. Perhaps it's time for the club to become history too. But I will be glad to hear any news if you learn anything new.
You mentioned your older brother, Stavros, disappearing after the deaths.
He was completely broken when Cyril, our younger brother, dared to jump right after Redzap... I think he didn't mind Redzap dying first, they never got along. Competed for years. But Cyril...
So Cyril wasn't the first to die?
No, it was Redzap's initiation first. When he didn't make it, Cyril, hotheaded as he was, decided to prove that it wasn't the fault of the ritual and that Redzap was simply not worthy. So he jumped.
Stavros was drunk all night. It was breaking him. I think he couldn't take the responsibility of being a leader when the club's sacred ritual was failing us.
And you don't know where he could've left?
No... I never searched for him as I thought he would want. But I heard people mention from time to time seeing his floating house in the waters around Gollanza occasionally.
You said that the ritual was meant to be safe?
The text of the ritual was a hint. "At the rise of the sun - flight. The feathered one - trust. At the lowest place - moon. With the sea's grace - honor."
Ah, so the slabs were a hint as I suspected. They were clearly swapped. Perhaps intentionally.
I hope I will be able to find out.
This... this is horrible. Who could've done that?.. And why?
I wanted to share with you that my assumption about slabs was correct and I was able to survive the initiation jump.
You... You really shouldn't have risked that. If only Cyril wasn't like this...
But... I must thank you for clearing the mystery of the ritual failure for me, I suppose. You didn't have to, but you risked to do it and I'm grateful for that.
You're welcome, mister Basil. And I'm not going to risk jumps like that in the future unless I'm absolutely sure it's safe.
Hello again, mister Basil. I have news about your brother. This is a message from him.
I suspected as much. But I didn't want to believe. It seems that the alcohol and isolation changed him so much that even his writing is almost unrecognizable. But it's his signature. Oh, Stavros...
I still think that the time for our club and our old rituals is over. I will pray for the dead, I will ask forgiveness for my brother. But otherwise, it's too late to change anything.
What are you going to do now?
I hope you understand, mister Sherlock. And even if truth brings me pain, I thank you for sharing it.
I understand. Goodbye, mister Basil.
Oh, thank goodness. Someone responded to my poster and so quickly!
What are you talking about?
My violin. It's been stolen. Police doesn't want to investigate it. So I'm willing to pay someone who's ready.
What do you mean police doesn't want to investigate?
I reported a theft, but they said that they don't have enough time to investigate every little robbery. And since nothing except the violin has been stolen, it's not a priority.
Nothing except the violin you say? Hm, I might take a crack at your case.
Thank you mister. My name is Anthony James. Come on inside.
Tell me everything you know about it.
There's not much I know, unfortunately. I rarely play lately, y fingers are not what they used to be. So I keep the violin in the display.
Morning of the 14th there was no violin in the display when I waked up. And all this mess around it. But except for the violin nothing valuable was stolen.
And the violin itself for me is more sentimentally valuable than financially.
Do you live alone in this house?
Mostly alone. My wife died, and our son is now in the Royal Navy. He's almost never here. That's his room behind the white door. But I don't go in there.
I have reason to believe that your son is the one who stole it.
No that's impossible. He told me that he is away at sea this whole week.
I got your violin back. Here you go.
Oh thank you so much!
I'm not as good as I once were, but I can play for you if you'd like.
I would be glad.
Bravo! It was great!
I have a confession to make: I remembered that melody now.
You don't know this, but as a kid I used to sneak to the attic of your house to listen to you play. It was just as amazing music then as it is now.
You are right young man. I didn't know it was you, but I definetely did know I had an audience. That was the only reasons I played.
If it weren't for you, I would have stoped playing long time ago. I'm really glad you appreciated it.
You know. I'm old and I never play anymore. I just sit alone in this house reminiscing about the times when someone listened to my music...
I want you to have it. The violin I mean. You look like a bright young man, who will easily learn how to play. Playing a violin is a great way to sort your thoughts and focus.
I made up my mind, it's yours. May it serve you well.
Your son was not at sea, you know. He is the one who stole your violin.
I'm sure he didn't mean bad. He would never do that out of evil. He must have been forced by the circumstances.
That's still a crime.
He's young. He lost his mother. I'll talk to him when he's back. Please don't report him.
What's wrong, ma'am?
I failed our dede, I failed Abdel. Eyvah, I lost it!
Calm down. What did you lose?
A dress for Jailan Hassan, Abdel's grand-daughter. The finest I've ever made.
I wanted to deliver it myself to see the girl happy. But I lost it along the way, at the market. Oh, my memory is like a sieve!
Did you stop to buy something?
Yes, I bought this and that. It's all in my basket.
Stay put, ma'am. I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, young man. May you be blessed!
I found your dress, ma'am. I'm surprised no one made off with it. It's a true work of art.
Hey you! What are you sniffing around here?
